comments:
Reproduceable on my end. 

- Set up remote debug session to an IP that exists, but will not respond
- start debug session
- quit eclipse


Exception in thread "MI Event Thread" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:
org/eclipse/cdt/debug/mi/core/cdi/event/ExitedEvent
	at org.eclipse.cdt.debug.mi.core.cdi.EventManager.update(EventManager.java:164)
	at java.util.Observable.notifyObservers(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.debug.mi.core.MISession.notifyObservers(MISession.java:532)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.debug.mi.core.EventThread.run(EventThread.java:46)

> Reproduceable on my end. 

Yes, it is.

This is a race condition, we just lack time to make a fix
for this.  It is of no consequence beside polluting your
.log file.

In essence  The MI plugin did not wait for all gdb session
to properly terminate.  To do this correctly we would have
to register all session and MIPlugin.stop() is call wait
for them to finish.

Let's move this to 3.0

>Let's move this to 3.0

Absolutely.

Sometimes I wonder if this sort of PR is just polluting bugzilla, or whether it
has any value. 

?yvind

> Sometimes I wonder if this sort of PR is just polluting bugzilla, or whether it
> has any value. 

Not at all, this is a valid PR and we need to track this down
'till we resolve the problem ...

Doing PR is a good way to track things.
I haven't seen this in ages. I suggest closing.
